nuclear energy.label: STRONGLY OPPOSED
nuclear energy.description: The ecological transition must prioritize renewables and energy efficiency; nuclear power is considered too expensive, slow to implement, and incompatible with the urgent need to reduce emissions by 2030, while also raising unresolved environmental concerns.

immigration.label: SUPPORTIVE
immigration.description: Policies of reception and inclusion are needed, aiming to facilitate integration pathways, guarantee migrants' rights, and build a European immigration management system based on solidarity among member states. Humanitarian corridors should be expanded for emergency situations.

reddito di cittadinanza.label: SUPPORTIVE
reddito di cittadinanza.description: The current system shouldn't be abolished, but we should address distortions. Proposals include recalibrating the benefit, introducing support for large families, a minimum wage, mandating pay for curricular internships, and abolishing unpaid extracurricular internships.

civil rights.label: STRONGLY SUPPORTIVE
civil rights.description: Support for equal marriage and adoption rights for same-sex couples, anti-homotransphobia laws, and recognition of LGBTQIA+ rights.

nuclear energy.label: STRONGLY OPPOSED
nuclear energy.description: Nuclear energy has high costs and safety risks. We should focus on a decentralized energy model that encourages self-production and local energy efficiency.

immigration.label: SUPPORTIVE
immigration.description: A humanitarian approach is needed, with integration policies and mandatory redistribution of migrants across Europe.

reddito di cittadinanza.label: STRONGLY SUPPORTIVE
reddito di cittadinanza.description: The reddito di cittadinanza is strongly defended, with proposals to enhance the efficiency of active labor policies and implement antifraud monitoring mechanisms.

civil rights.label: STRONGLY SUPPORTIVE
civil rights.description: Support for equal marriage, anti-homotransphobia legislation.

nuclear energy.label: SUPPORTIVE
nuclear energy.description: Including nuclear energy in the energy mix is needed to achieve the 'net zero emissions' goal by 2050, considering it necessary to meet future energy needs safely and efficiently.

immigration.label: SUPPORTIVE
immigration.description: A regulated and planned immigration system is needed, with integration policies, regularization for those with jobs, and training pathways. Expanding humanitarian corridors and establishing a Ministry for Migration are also supported.

reddito di cittadinanza.label: OPPOSED
reddito di cittadinanza.description: The current system is considered ineffective. It should be reformed to be reserved only for those unfit for work. The benefit should be revoked after the first job refusal, and a time limit should be imposed: if no employment is found within two years, the amount is reduced.

civil rights.label: SUPPORTIVE
civil rights.description: We need the introduction of laws against homophobia and transphobia, the creation of an Anti-Discrimination Authority.

nuclear energy.label: STRONGLY SUPPORTIVE
nuclear energy.description: We should support the development of next-generation nuclear power. This includes investment in research, production facilities, and integration with renewable energy sources to ensure energy security and reduce dependence on imports.

immigration.label: STRONGLY OPPOSED
immigration.description: We should stop illegal immigration, with the support for stricter control policies, naval blockades, and flow management through bilateral agreements with countries of origin. We should create European-managed centers outside Europe to process asylum requests and distribute refugees fairly.

reddito di cittadinanza.label: STRONGLY OPPOSED
reddito di cittadinanza.description: We should abolish the reddito di cittadinanza, with a preference for targeted support measures for employment and vulnerable groups to prevent abuse.

civil rights.label: STRONGLY OPPOSED
civil rights.description: We should avoid reforms introducing new rights regarding family and gender identity, with a preference for defending the 'traditional family.'
